830 Mike Johnson endorsed Mamdani by not passing a single fucking thing to protect our elections. posted 7 days ago by Spotlight 59 comments award share download report block
59 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save CounterStrike 39 points 7 days ago He hasn't passed shit. Everything is an EO and not codified permalink award report block reply Lamal 6 points 7 days ago how do you do that? Republicans don't have 60 in the Senate and it's up to Thune to end the filibuster (but it is quite a hard decision to make) permalink parent award report block reply MastaJoda 1 points 6 days ago not everything needs 60 votes... permalink parent award report block reply Oracle 3 points 6 days ago Any type of law that’s going to mandate how states conduct their elections would absolutely need 60 votes unless the senate gets off their ass and ditches the filibuster.  Then you’re going to have major legal challenges since, I think states are supposed to choose how to do their elections. permalink parent award report block reply HOSEQ 2 points 6 days ago No, but Every MAGA Group needs Division.... permalink parent award report block reply Lamal 2 points 6 days ago Exactly.  Spelling it out for those here, the people here (and even well known e-celebs) wishing that MJ could pass more legislation usually can't define the terms FILIBUSTER, CLOTURE, or RECONCILIATION. Knowing this, a lot of agitators use this to get people to be mad at congress for "Not doing anything" i.e. not passing new bills. PLEASE ALL HELP EDUCATE FOLKS HERE so we can block this tactic. permalink parent award report block reply view 1 more comments... Lamal 1 points 6 days ago Once per session of congress, Budget items (ONLY !) can pass the senate with only a simple majority. This is called the reconciliation process. Mike Johnson used this process for the "One Big Beautiful Bill" which had in it practically everything we could legally do. Besides this, I know of no other type of legislation that only needs less than 60 votes. (feel free to educate me on it) permalink parent award report block reply trumpORbust 1 points 6 days ago It's an easy decision -- fillabuster has been an delay and stall trick for years, let's try a few without it and lock in AF policies permalink parent award report block reply aaafirefly123 2 points 6 days ago Both sides are afraid to get rid of it for a number of reasons. Reason #1: Fear of what will happen when the opposition takes over and you become powerless to do anything to force them to compromise. Reason #2: Getting rid of the filibuster is basically an admission that bipartisanship is a failure and that compromise is impossible. This all but ensures a civil war as now control over Congress is a winner take all game in which the winners can force whatever they want down the throats of the defeated and them being powerless to do anything about it. permalink parent award report block reply trumpORbust 1 points 6 days ago Getting 61 senators does the same thing -- we have one little chance to strike and must take it... Hell, put the fillabuster back before the next election that matters permalink parent award report block reply view 2 more comments...
